de.dfki.opcua.client

Class OmsOpcUaClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.dfki.opcua.client.OmsOpcUaClient

  • public class OmsOpcUaClient
extends java.lang.Object
    A basic client for other applications to use.

    Grants access to a OPC UA server that models a running OMS, allowing user authentication, browsing of the memory nodes, changing payloads and metadata, and calling methods.
    Author:
    xekl01

    • Constructor Detail

      • OmsOpcUaClient

        public OmsOpcUaClient()
        Constructor. Creates and configures a new client to connect to a server modelling an OMS in OPC UA, standard server address is used (opc.tcp://localhost:52521).

      • OmsOpcUaClient

        public OmsOpcUaClient(java.lang.String serverAddress)
        Constructor. Creates and configures a new client to connect to a server modelling an OMS in OPC UA, without using user credentials.
        Parameters:
        serverAddress - Address of the server with which to connect

      • OmsOpcUaClient

        public OmsOpcUaClient(java.lang.String userName,
                      java.lang.String userPw)
        Constructor. Creates and configures a new client to connect to a server modelling an OMS in OPC UA, using the given user credentials and standard server address (opc.tcp://localhost:52521).
        Parameters:
        userName - Name of the user requesting OMS information
        userPw - Password of the user requesting OMS information

      • OmsOpcUaClient

        public OmsOpcUaClient(java.lang.String serverAddress,
                      java.lang.String userName,
                      java.lang.String userPw)
        Constructor. Creates and configures a new client to connect to a server modelling an OMS in OPC UA, using the given user credentials.
        Parameters:
        serverAddress - Address of the server with which to connect
        userName - Name of the user requesting OMS information
        userPw - Password of the user requesting OMS information

        Reads the value of a given node (if node is a variable).
        Parameters:

      • run

        public void run()
        Starts the client into an I/O loop until the exit command is entered, then shuts it down.
